meanings.definition: The act of issuing too much of something.
meanings.sent1: The overissuances of tickets led to chaos at the event.
meanings.sent2: The company faced financial troubles due to overissuances of shares.
meanings.sent3: The overissuances of candy at the party made the children ecstatic.
meanings.sent4: Her overissuances of apologies made her seem insincere.
meanings.sent5: The overissuances of homework overwhelmed the students.

meanings.definition: Excessive issuance of a particular item.
meanings.sent1: The overissuances of coupons flooded the market.
meanings.sent2: The overissuances of permits caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent3: The overissuances of compliments made her blush.
meanings.sent4: The overissuances of warnings fell on deaf ears.
meanings.sent5: The overissuances of gifts made the recipient uncomfortable.
